intro: Ardisia capitellata, commonly known as the clustered beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its attractive, clustered inflorescences that produce small, dark purple berries. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are glossy and elliptical, while its flowers are small and white, often overlooked in favor of its showy fruit. The berries are an important food source for birds and other wildlife.
